docs.snippet: One-week furloughs immediately after induction for New York City's Selective Service registrants already are in effect, Colonel Arthur V. McDermott, draft director here, said yesterday, although in many parts of the country until Nov. 17 registrants...
docs.lead_paragraph: One-week furloughs immediately after induction for New York City's Selective Service registrants already are in effect, Colonel Arthur V. McDermott, draft director here, said yesterday, although in many parts of the country until Nov. 17 registrants will get two weeks.
docs.abstract: Col McDermott repts 1 wk furlough already in effect, NYC; announces new directive authorizing acceptance without personal-history forms of aliens from 49 countries; list

headline.main: SHORTER FURLOUGH IS IN EFECT HERE; Reduction to One Week for Inductees Will Be Widened to Nation by Nov. 17 RULING ON FOREIGN-BORN Citizens of 49 Countries Now Acceptable Without Filing Personal History Data

docs.snippet: Four hundred and eleven fellowships and scholarships have been awarded by the Institute of International Education for the academic year 1942-43, it was announced yesterday. In an exchange program, students from South America are studying in this...
docs.lead_paragraph: Four hundred and eleven fellowships and scholarships have been awarded by the Institute of International Education for the academic year 1942-43, it was announced yesterday. In an exchange program, students from South America are studying in this country, while a number of Americans are studying in the South American lands.

headline.main: 411 GRANTS MADE IN EXCHANGE-STUDY; The Institute of International Education Announces Its Awards for 1942-43

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Nov. 13 -- The Foreign Ministry issued an official communique today acknowledging receipt of three confidential memoranda delivered by the United States Ambassador, Norman Armour, on Nov. 3, 4 and 10, on espionage activities...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Nov. 13 -- The Foreign Ministry issued an official communique today acknowledging receipt of three confidential memoranda delivered by the United States Ambassador, Norman Armour, on Nov. 3, 4 and 10, on espionage activities of Axis agents on Argentine territory.
docs.abstract: Argentine Foreign Ministry acknowledges US memo on Welles charges; investigation ordered

headline.main: U.S. PUTS CHARGES BEFORE ARGENTINA; Memoranda on Axis Espionage Are Acknowledged -- Follow Lines of Chilean Case

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 -- Miss Mary M. Cannon, the first official working women's ambassador from the United States to Latin America, will fly to Brazil tomorrow on her second trip as inter-American representative of the Department of Labor's Women's...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 -- Miss Mary M. Cannon, the first official working women's ambassador from the United States to Latin America, will fly to Brazil tomorrow on her second trip as inter-American representative of the Department of Labor's Women's Bureau.
docs.abstract: M M Cannon to study war role, Latin-Amer, and select women to study US women's interests

headline.main: TO REPORT ON WOMEN WORKING IN AMERICAS; Miss Cannon Flies to Brazil Today to Begin War Labor Study

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 28 -- Eight hundred and sixty thousand voters, including 328,000 women, will go to the polls tomorrow in one of the important elections in the history of Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 28 -- Eight hundred and sixty thousand voters, including 328,000 women, will go to the polls tomorrow in one of the important elections in the history of Uruguay.
docs.abstract: election to be held; candidates and platforms described

headline.main: URUGUAYANS ELECT A PRESIDENT TODAY; New Senate and Chamber of Deputies Will Also Be Chosen -- Voters Total 860,000 CONSTITUTION IS AT STAKE Ballot Will Decide Between Liberal Baldomir Draft and Reactionary Terra Plan
